issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: Use another means to configure admin tools with CLC service endpoints

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
With {{clcadmin-assume-system-credentials}}, it's missing the ec2 endpoint,

{noformat}
# eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials`; euserv-describe-node-controllers --debug
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 DEBUG   DescribeNodeControllers parsed arguments: {'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': None, 'show_headers': False, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'ec2_url': None, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None}
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 INFO    Config   novalue for default-region
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 INFO    Config finding global option max-retries
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 INFO    Config   novalue for max-retries
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 INFO    Config finding global option timeout
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 INFO    Config   novalue for timeout
2016-02-17 10:09:29,218 DEBUG   HmacV4Auth using auth info from environment
euserv-describe-node-controllers: error: No ec2 endpoint to connect to was given. Configured regions with ec2 endpoints are: aws:ap-northeast-1, aws:ap-southeast-1, aws:ap-southeast-2, aws:cn-north-1, aws:eu-central-1, aws:eu-west-1, aws:sa-east-1, aws:us-east-1, aws:us-gov-west-1, aws:us-west-1, aws:us-west-2, localhost
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/euserv-describe-node-controllers", line 6, in <module>
    eucalyptus_admin.commands.bootstrap.describenodecontrollers.DescribeNodeControllers.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 277, in run
    cmd = cls(_do_cli=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 91, in __init__
    BaseCommand.__init__(self, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 100, in __init__
    self._post_init()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 99, in _post_init
    BaseCommand._post_init(self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 109, in _post_init
    self.configure()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucalyptus_admin/commands/bootstrap/describenodecontrollers.py", line 45, in configure
    self.service, url=self.args.get('ec2_url'))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 72, in from_other
    new.configure()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucalyptus_admin/commands/ec2/__init__.py", line 46, in configure
    requestbuilder.service.BaseService.configure(self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 102, in configure
    self.validate_config()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 131, in validate_config
    raise ServiceInitError(msg)
requestbuilder.exceptions.ServiceInitError: No ec2 endpoint to connect to was given. Configured regions with ec2 endpoints are: aws:ap-northeast-1, aws:ap-southeast-1, aws:ap-southeast-2, aws:cn-north-1, aws:eu-central-1, aws:eu-west-1, aws:sa-east-1, aws:us-east-1, aws:us-gov-west-1, aws:us-west-1, aws:us-west-2, localhost
{noformat}

With eucalyptus admin ini file, the node controllers information is in the debug output, but are not being printed,
{noformat}
[root@scale-01-01-01 ~]# euserv-describe-node-controllers --region admin@dev
[root@scale-01-01-01 ~]#

{noformat}

However when both are used, it works as expected,
{noformat}
# eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials`; euserv-describe-node-controllers --region admin@dev
NODE  three  10.112.10.25  enabled
INSTANCE  i-d4431304
NODE  two  10.112.10.35  enabled
INSTANCE  i-1f7e3ddf
NODE  one  10.112.10.9  enabled
INSTANCE  i-1dd34064
{noformat}
fields.summary: DescribeServicesResponses only include NCs when coming from CLCs, breaking euserv-describe-node-controllers

comments.body: The difference is in which bootstrap endpoint you ask.  Only the CLC replies with NCs in its service list, so when you use DNS you wind up with a response from a UFS box instead.
